alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 24 at 5:37AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Abundant amounts of moisture will be lifting over a front in the Carolinas and intersecting with the central and southern Appalachians. This is a favorable weather pattern for excessive rainfall. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... The Flood Watch continues for * Portions of central Virginia and southwest Virginia, including the following areas, in central Virginia, Campbell. In southwest Virginia, Pulaski. * Until 8 AM EDT this morning * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Roads may become covered with water and impassable.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
